eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905

java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

The problem seems that my launch doesn't exist, but it does exist.  It even appears in the navigator view.

Created an attachment (id=46750)
The launch config Eclipse doesn't see
My *.launch file doesn't appear in the external tools, so I cannot run it.

I am unable to reproduce on either Linux or WinXP. I can take your config, import it into my workspace and view it in the dialog, etc. 

Are there any steps before or after that causes this error? Does the error happen all of the time, or was this a one time thing?

The problem happens always.  There must be something misconfigured.
To reproduce the error, I just have to launch Eclipse, and my *.launch (which simply runs Ant) isn't shown and I cannot run it.  Some others *.launch very similar are shown and can be run ok.
Are you using working sets? Is the project it is open or closed? Filtering in the launch dialog might be causing the launch to not show up in the dialog or let you run it.

I use working sets for:

1) Searching files
2) Filtering errors in the "Problems" view.

But don't know how to use working sets for the external tools launch dialog.

The project is of course open (I can see and run successfully other *.launch in the same workspace and the same project).
what happens if you disable all of the filtering in the launch dialog and uncheck filtering by config type from the Run/Debug->Launching->Launch Configurations pref page?

I have removed all the filters in the External tools dialog, and don't see the same *.launch that are missing.
I didn't know filtering was available there.
what happens if you try to view the configuration in a new workspace?
we have not been able to reproduce this on windows, linux, or mac. it must be a configuration issue, makring as WORKSFORME
